website_summaries.verdict: A favored locking system with a long-lasting battery. However, some would prefer a longer access code, and the unit can be too bulky for storm doors.
pros: in fact, some locksmiths have trouble getting into it
Battery changes are fast and easy
cons: Unit may not warn of low battery, creating an unpleasant surprise if the keypad goes dead
Keypad can jut out too far, keeping storm doors from closing
Some users would prefer a longer code

customer_reviews.title: After a couple of weeks it stop working!
customer_reviews.text: It works perfectly for the first 3 weeks... then, suddently, it just did not open from outside... hopefully there were somenone inside, we thought could be the battery... it may have a long time in a warehouse I thought... So I change the battery and start working properly again but just for a week, this time with no one inside the apartment, and the best thing is that the “security” key... did not work at all. The key fit it but do not open it. ..... Amazon did not reimbursed me...
customer_reviews.author: Carlos

customer_reviews.title: Stops Working After a Year - NOT DEPENDABLE
customer_reviews.text: Save your money and go with a different brand. I purchased two of these locks and they worked for roughly 12 months before both of them started to have the same problem: the key code is entered and the light turns green, however, the lock will not catch and you are unable to lock or unlock the door. This has been a major headache for me as I use the products for our Airbnb and we've had guests locked out. NOT DEPENDABLE. I would spend your money on another product and another brand. The customer service at Schlage was not very understanding and did not offer a suitable solution for me.
customer_reviews.author: Rooz

customer_reviews.title: Junk - electronics and buttons fail shortly after 1yr warranty
customer_reviews.text: Do not install in cold climates or direct sunlight, Cold causes these devices to fail to engage, doesn't unlock. Both cold and direct sunlight damages the buttons making unit un-useable. They don't honor warranty, which in itself shouldn't even be needed on a quality product. Normally schlage and locks are solid, but if you add schlage+electronic locks = junk. I wouldn't recommend these to family or friends. Also, if you have a second screen/door, these locks extend too far and interfere with door handles on the second door.
customer_reviews.author: Spamhater007

customer_reviews.title: Issues after a couple of years
customer_reviews.text: Purchased one of these for our garage door. It worked really great for the first couple of years then it's now starting to I guess you would call it slipping. This happens when locking and unlocking. It's like the mechanism doesn't engage all the way so it just spins and doesn't lock or unlock. Sometimes it might work after the second or third try but then sometimes you have to just go through the big garage door and open it from the inside. I tried replacing the battery but that didn't help. Debating on trashing it or replacing it with something more dependable.
customer_reviews.author: Tim King

customer_reviews.title: Looks and Works Like New After 4 years
customer_reviews.text: This is a good solid lock that still looks brand new and works well nearly 4 years after purchase. It was easy to install and easy to change the controls as long as you keep the instructions. It takes a 9 volt battery that lasts a long time and when I changed the battery, all the codes were saved. So I didn’t have to redo all the codes. The keypad lights up and the beeps can be turned on or off. Recommended
customer_reviews.author: ReviewMistress

customer_reviews.title: Just over 3 years and it broke!
customer_reviews.text: Just over 3 years and it broke, basically the outside knob just spins and spins regardless of the code or a key. I can unlock and lock from the inside. Their customer support is closed on the weekend. You know, because people don't need a working lock on the weekend. I am going to call their support on Monday and see what they say. I will update after.
customer_reviews.author: Mantoni

customer_reviews.title: DEAD AFTER THREE YEARS!!!!
customer_reviews.text: THREE YEAR UPDAT: I’ve had this lock for three years now. Just this morning the mechanism to engage the dead bolt no longer works from the outside. Thank god there was someone else in the house or I would have been locked out. I watched a couple videos and tried the fixes they suggested. Only worked for a couple hours after that until I was face with the same problem again. Guess I need to buy another lock after only three years. It was a great lock up until this point so I would say if you buy this one proceed with caution and have a back up plan to get into your house.
customer_reviews.author: Will C.

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy this lock
customer_reviews.text: I have 2 of these and both are not longer functioning. The handle just turns and does not catch to lock or unlock. Both worked well at first but one failed after 8 months and the other after abut 15 months. I took one apart and can see that the tab from the lock side is too short to reach the slot to turn the lock. Schlage has a known problem and yet continues to sell crap. I replaced these with a Kwikset model. Schlage was once a great product but now I would avoid them.
customer_reviews.author: WLS

customer_reviews.title: Needed replacement after a year
customer_reviews.text: I installed the lock myself twice (the original lock and the replacement) and needed to call customer service both times. Fortunately, customer service was very helpful. The bad news is that the lock wore out after a year. When I called customer service, the representative knew what the problem was before I finished explaining it (the gears within the lock wore out). That tells me this problem occurs often. The replacement lock arrived in a few weeks and is currently working. I'll try to remember to post an update in a year if there are no further problems.
customer_reviews.author: David Levner

customer_reviews.title: Ok lock while it lasted, died in less than a year
customer_reviews.text: I bought two of these about a year ago and only one is still working. The other one stopped responding to valid codes entries even though the lights were on But it just simply wouldn’t enable the thumb latch to j lock the door for us. I changed the batteries, I double checked the connections, I reset the lock, then I threw it away.
customer_reviews.author: CKDad

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy!
customer_reviews.text: This product will work great and you will be very happy! But only for two years. Then the handle will just turn without latching. When this happens and you can't get in, even with the key! It's not that I got a faulty lock; this is a common problem. I bought three of these and it happened to each one. Search online for solutions. You will see that you have to disassemble the entire lock and re-adjust the mechanism. This would be tolerable, but unfortunately this fix is only temporary and the same problem will keep coming back! Save yourself the headache and go somewhere else!
customer_reviews.author: Chris Freiling

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful and Easy to Operate
customer_reviews.text: This keypad door lock has an elegant brushed-pewter finish that looks great on our front door. A locksmith installed it for me in a matter of minutes (simply because I knew I couldn't do it as quickly as a professional would). Afterward, I was able to follow the provided instructions to create individual access codes for everyone in the house. The lock is easy to use, even for the most technologically challenged. I definitely recommend the Schlage Camelot Keypad Deadbolt for anyone looking to upgrade from traditional deadbolt locks.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa N.

customer_reviews.title: It's a good solid lock
customer_reviews.text: It's a good solid lock. I had our handyman install it. It took him an hour, as he had to enlarge the hole from the lock it was replacing. Then, he couldn't get it to accept a combination. Turned out the 9V battery that comes with the lock was defective. Putting out a fraction of what it needed to. So he had to go down the hill to Ace Hardware, buy a new battery, take the lock apart and install it. Works fine and we are happy with it. But it cost me an extra hour of his time, at $30/hour, plus $5 for the battery. Not a happy camper here. Why was the lock shipped with a defective battery?
customer_reviews.author: Marvin J. Wolf

customer_reviews.title: Disable the easy open function
customer_reviews.text: I only give this 4 stars for lock feature and easy to lock because it comes with a default that allows it to be unlocked quickly by pressing the main button. We had it for over a year before I realized it could be unlocked with out the code. I finally had to find the detailed instructions online (it’s not listed in paper instructions) to disable that function. It’s really not safe until you do that.
customer_reviews.author: Jaime

customer_reviews.title: Horrible! Do not buy from Amazon. Buy it from Home Depot or Lowes so you have a better return window and it's cheaper!!!
customer_reviews.text: I've had the refurbished lock for a little over a month. The first time that it wouldn't unlock or lock, I thought it was a fluke. I tried again tonight, and was almost locked out of my place. I took the lock apart, and realized that the piece that controls the lock was very loose. I'm highly disappointed in this and would not recommend anyone buying this product. Unsure how to contact the seller, so no clue on if I would even go through them again. :(
customer_reviews.author: Klam

customer_reviews.title: Bought 3, one failed.
customer_reviews.text: We have 3 exterior doors. After giving up on several rounds of TruBolt electronic locks, I switched to these. Installation is fine, they look fine, they work fine. I'm not picky. But the most important thing about a lock is its reliability, and today one of the three locks stopped working. It works with the physical key, it works with the interior lever, the battery is full, and I can hear it click after entering the keycode, but the knob just spins and doesn't engage. Super frustrating. I expected more from Schlage.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Thomas

customer_reviews.title: 3.5 years and zero issues
customer_reviews.text: I bought this in July 2016, installed it and have never given it much thought since. It’s used at least 10 times a day and we’ve never had a problem. I love that my kids don’t have a key to lose and when something prevents me from getting home on time, I can ask a neighbor to use the secondary code to let my dog out. The code is easy to change. The only reason I’m back is to purchase another one for my garage door so the kids make less mess in my front entryway. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Peppery

customer_reviews.title: What a disappointing product from a name brand. Get locked out regularly!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this because of the name, figured it would be better than all the new brands of electronic locks popping up. Man was i wrong. 20% of the time after the code is entered, the motor does not engage and gets stuck. This makes us have to use the key. Now the key tumbler is getting jammed and no longer works either. We bought anther brand for the garage door and it has been flawless. This one is getting replaced after 2 years of headaches.
customer_reviews.author: BillP

customer_reviews.title: Dependable
customer_reviews.text: This is my second lock, replacing the same model I installed eight years ago. A good battery lasts over two years and gives ample warning when it is time to be replaced. The lock always functioned but in the end, the internal mechanism that engages the bolt started to slip. Sometimes I needed to turn the locking lever more than once before it would engage. I can't tell if it is the solenoid or something in the linkage became bent or worn. I've looked at the new locks on the market now, but nothing inspired confidence. I trust this lock so I bought another.
customer_reviews.author: Anonymous

customer_reviews.title: The keypad is "digital" but the lock is NOT.  Still manual
customer_reviews.text: 1. The color matched perfectly with my Nickel. 2. everything included 3. everything fit. 4. I'm not the handiest person, but was able to figure it out with the directions. 5. I realized the keypad is digital, but the LOCK is not. My family would enter the code thinking it would UNLOCK and technically it did, but you still have to turn the knob to really unlock it.. The keypad unlocks digitally and the physically turning of the knob is what moves the deadbolt over. A little confusing at first, but everyone got it now. Would I buy it again? YES. Well built, easy to install. looks nice.
customer_reviews.author: R. Huang

customer_reviews.title: Hard to install
customer_reviews.text: My husband was not very happy installing this. He's very handy, he change locks around our houses many times before. But this lock really got to him! The instruction wasn't very good, it seemed to skip a couple of steps!!! And when I try to try set up the pin, it took several tries. The instruction is not very clear. We had kwikset locks before and I wish we should stayed with kwikset! They're a lot easier to install.
customer_reviews.author: Alia

customer_reviews.title: Schlage reputation well deserved
customer_reviews.text: Adding this Schlage lock to our front door was a good decision. Schlage has a reputation for making solid locks and this model does not disappoint. Good length for the deadbolt means that it engages solidly with the jamb and provides proper protection against kicking and prying. The internal works move smoothly, installation was a breeze, and the directions were clear and concise. (Anyone with moderate knowledge on small DIY projects should be able to install this lock in less than 30 minutes or so.)
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great Lock, questionable longevity
customer_reviews.text: I've bought 3 of these locks and one of them failed at 1 year and 3 days. After reading several reviews I see the fail wasn't a fluke and short lifespan is a common complaint. I also noticed this seller is selling this lock under a new title with spaces added to the name (with less negative reviews) Beware, this product appears flawed and the seller seams to be trying to hide it.
customer_reviews.author: Jerry Shepherd

customer_reviews.title: Do not work in inclement weather
customer_reviews.text: Unfortunately we loved this product when we purchased it but it quickly stops working in inclement weather. We have purchased a total of 6 and all 6 have the same problem, we have even bought covers for them to keep moisture out but they ways quit working in cold or wet weather, this is a problem considering we have them on our Airbnb rentals and are not always home when guests need to check in. We have called the company but as of yet,no resolution.
customer_reviews.author: stacey

customer_reviews.title: This is a "low tech" electronic deadbolt that is perfect for people who do not like to carry keys.
customer_reviews.text: This was exactly what I was looking for. This is a "low tech" electronic deadbolt. There is no wireless connectivity to be hacked. The keypad includes 10 digits. The battery is not wasted to open the deadbolt; you just turn the knob once you key in the correct code. This is a great deadbolt for people who do not like to carry keys or if you have children and you want to keep the door locked. Installation was not bad; however, there was a need to adjust some of the mounting holes and deadbolt slot. Easy for someone with basic tool skills.
customer_reviews.author: J. Hault

customer_reviews.title: Easy to install and secure
customer_reviews.text: I didn't want additional bells and whistles like Bluetooth or integration with Alexa/Siri/etc. This is the second time I purchased this set, the last time being 6 years ago. Only reason I purchased new is because I sold my house with the other. The 9 volt battery that sits inside lasts literally forever when you don't have all this other BS tech added to it. I never had to change the battery once.
customer_reviews.author: chickenmonkey

customer_reviews.title: Quick installation and asy to program
customer_reviews.text: I had this installed by a locksmith in 30 minutes to replace my existing key deadbolt (no additional drilling necessary), but if you're handy and have your own tools, you can probably do it yourself. According to other reviewers, the battery draining quickly is only an issue if the strike plate isn't lined up evenly with the deadbolt. This would force the lock to repeated try to lock itself, thus depleting the battery. I made sure to mention this to the locksmith and he double checked that it locked smoothly. I programed the user codes myself, so you don't need to be a locksmith to do that. Just read the included instruction manual.
customer_reviews.author: Deedee312

customer_reviews.title: Faulty lock mechanism failed within a year, but customer service good
customer_reviews.text: I got another one of these after having to replace the unit that started to give me problems after five years. The new one worked great for about 11 months, and then the latching mechanism when you turn the knob to open the door started to fail, causing you to spin the knob maybe five, six, seven times in order to open the door again. I called customer service and they agreed to send me a replacement which was great, but I have concerns about the quality of the mechanism going forward.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Dummy

customer_reviews.title: Just Quits Working
customer_reviews.text: Worked very well until it didn't one day. After entering the code, it just spins. The code was accepted via the green light. It stopped engaging the locking and unlocking mechanism. The key still works, but that is now finicky. Still, glad we had a key unlike others that had to pay a lock smith double the value of this lock to allow them entry into their house. I would expect this behavior many years after installation, but it hasn't been that long.
customer_reviews.author: Charles

customer_reviews.title: Crappy lock BROKE!  We are either locked in and can't get out of the house or we cannot lock it at all.
customer_reviews.text: We have had this lock for just over a year and a part of the deadbolt broke! The lock was sticking and sometimes the door would lock and we could not get outside the house and sometimes it would not lock at all, which was even more annoying. We went to Home Depot to purchase a new lock and they confirmed a piece inside the Schlage broke. This has been giving us headaches for weeks now. We cannot find the replacement part online so now we will have to go through Schlage to get it replaced (hopefully). I would not get this lock again. Very disappointing and not an inexpensive item!
customer_reviews.author: Nicky Jacobson

customer_reviews.title: Great product. Easy installation.
customer_reviews.text: This keyless deadbolt works great and looks great! I was going to hire a handyman to install it but after watching an installation video on YouTube, I decided to give it a try. It was very easy to install and only took about 15-20 minutes (that included me pausing the video after each step). I’m very happy with my purchase and I’m proud of the fact that I was able to do it myself.
customer_reviews.author: No-shame-in-my-game67

customer_reviews.title: A perfect Lock
customer_reviews.text: Replaced my keyed deadbolt on front door with this lock. Could not be more pleased with this product. Installation was a snap. Directions were great. To lock it upon leaving home, it is simply hitting a button and turning the lock - very easy and convenient. There are multiple codes you can program for unlocking which is convenient. I can't think of any way they could have improved this lock.
customer_reviews.author: Ron Vedova

customer_reviews.title: The Schlage button gets hung
customer_reviews.text: We have had this product for six months. We ordered two of them. Only one has an issue. The Schlage button gets stuck depressed and it seems like the lock isn’t working because the lights don’t work. This isn’t a problem for us but for our housekeeper and dog sitter, they can get locked out of the house because they don’t know understand how to fix it. The lock itself is great but one of them is defective which has caused us issues.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Breaks after a couple of months
customer_reviews.text: Worked great for a couple months, but then the turning mechanism stopped working. When you put in the code, you can hear it click, but the the thing you turn to actually move the deadbolt just spins and spins without unlocking the deadbolt. Same problem when trying to lock it - you push the lock button and the turning thing just spins without moving the deadbolt. You can still lock/unlock it from the inside, but that's not the point of having a keypad lock!
customer_reviews.author: Marrria

customer_reviews.title: The locking mechanism needs to be manually engaged from inside and outside, hence it is not ideal for rental purpose.
customer_reviews.text: One thing you need to know about this keypad deadbolt is that it needs to be manually engaged from inside and outside. It does not locked itself when you close the door. It is not an issue for private use. However, if you rented your room/house out on airbnb, people often leave the door unlocked because they are not familiar with this keypad. I used this keypad for a little over a year and the battery is still going strong. It is very easy to install (very clear installation instruction) and easy to use (setting new code, deleting old code, etc). It is also very secure.
customer_reviews.author: yishin

customer_reviews.title: Keyless Deadbolt
customer_reviews.text: This is overall great! You do need to push on the lock as you're locking the door because it will sort of stick or scrape if you don't and doesn't fully engage the lock. It engages it enough to lock the door but not a tight fully secured lock. So partly how it's manufactured and partly due to human error. Common sense made me aware of this but for others, not so much. It doesn't make the lock not work, at least so far. This is for my Airbnb cottage so it gets a lot of use and I will have to see how it holds up over time.
customer_reviews.author: dbnative

customer_reviews.title: Replacement after 7 years
customer_reviews.text: Put one on our front door 7 years ago. It stuck in the unlock position one night. Luckily I had an old deadbolt lying around and swapped it out so we could lock the door that night. I saved the old one and may take it apart someday to fix it. But the keypad was getting pretty worn down so I just ordered a new one. Quick and easy to install. I'll never have a keyed deadbolt again.
customer_reviews.author: RR

customer_reviews.title: ... had this installed for 2 months and its working great. It was as easy to install as a ...
customer_reviews.text: I have had this installed for 2 months and its working great. It was as easy to install as a regular lock, (replaced an existing lock). The keypad is far better than using a key. I still keep a key on me, but my wife often does not, so it saves her time and trouble when she goes out without them. I considered one of the more expensive locks that work with the internet, but decided on this more simple lock. The internet based locks make me fear that the door will open itself when I am not home or not open when I need it to. At any rate, I don't think you can go wrong with this lock.
customer_reviews.author: Perry

customer_reviews.title: Very nice
customer_reviews.text: Purchased about 2 years ago. Love it. Battery lasts a long time since it doesn't have to actually move the deadbolt. Very quick to come and go. I replaced all the exterior locks and rekeyed them all myself. Two are keypads. Each family member has their own code. We still keep a key on the keyrings just in case but never have had to use them. Plus with two keypads, even if a battery died without the expected warning, odds are we can still get in the other door. Just don't get caught out because these aren't easy to bypass from what I've heard.
customer_reviews.author: Geek Noob

customer_reviews.title: Work great at first
customer_reviews.text: This lock was relatively easy to install and it was easy to setup however after using it for 2 years it has already started to not work properly. I am not sure if 2 years is the self life of these locks but if so I would not buy these types of products. The main issue with this lock is that when you enter the code to unlock you turn to unlock and it doesn't work. The key doesn't work either. something seems to have come loose inside. I would not recommend this product at all unless you plan to use it for only a short time. definitely not intended to every day use.
customer_reviews.author: cpark1982

customer_reviews.title: Don't go with Schlage Anymore
customer_reviews.text: Isaac is correct about these locks. I replaced 4 of these locks within 2 yrs. Couldn't believe they went bad with minimal use. I recently bought two more but I will return them before installing. I cannot chance these going bad. I used these brands for about 15 years and done with schlage. The lock will spin and you will get locked out. Don't chance it!!
customer_reviews.author: POLICE MILLENIA

customer_reviews.title: Stops functioning
customer_reviews.text: This lock worked as expected when I first bought it but after only about a year of use it began to fail. Now at least 8/10 times when I punch in the code to lock the door, the lock just spins around and doesn't engage the deadbolt. This was only happening occasionally at first, now I'll often spend several minutes trying to get it to lock - sometimes I even give up and leave my house through the backyard. I hope the manufacturer corrects this issue or sends a replacement because it sounds like this is becoming a common issue based on other reviews.
customer_reviews.author: kb238410

customer_reviews.title: Great deadbolt
customer_reviews.text: I now have three of these installed at 2 different houses. I love the ease in setting and removing codes. I use it on a vacation rental where I can set a new code for each incoming guest and remove the previous guest code all in minutes. On my own home it has been useful for our dog walker, house sitters and repairman appointments. Just set a code for them and remove the code when done. Using the first one multiple times per day for quite some time now and still no need for battery replacement.
customer_reviews.author: LeeJ45

customer_reviews.title: DONT BUY! PIECE OF JUNK
customer_reviews.text: What a piece of junk. Lock lasted about 1 week. Slow blinking red light. Cannot reprogram changed battery, nothing. Instructions offer minimal troubleshooting help. It was great for the one week that it worked. I wonder if they sent me a refurbished one because looking back through the box I do not see a key that should have come with it for a manual entry during an emergency situation. Greatful that my garage opener was functioning or I would have had to call a locksmith
customer_reviews.author: Alexander Piller

customer_reviews.title: These are my favorite keypad locks
customer_reviews.text: These are my favorite keypad locks. The best feature is the 9v battery only engages the lock and you manually move the bolt. This lets the battery last for over a year so far. The kwikset keypad motors the bolt and runs out it's 4, AA batteries in a couple of months. Plus if your deadbolt isn't perfectly lined up, the motorized version won't work. It also comes with a reinforced striker plate and long wood screws for more strength. The screws were really soft and I stripped the phillips head though. I used heavy duty GRP screws from Lowe's instead.
customer_reviews.author: G. Zimmerman

customer_reviews.title: Best lock i ever bought.
customer_reviews.text: Best thing ever. Have a ton of keys for work. Coming home after dealing with...the regular nonsense to push in a code and get in your house is just about the best feeling ever. Fiddling with keys after a commute really urked me. Great Quality. No problems. Recommend giving diff family members diff codes, so that way the buttons never wear on one particular pattern. Everyone has diff buttons, they all wear evenly. (note: about a year no wear) but saw some comments when i purchased them. Easy to program. Easy to use. Extremely durable.
customer_reviews.author: Jim Morrison

customer_reviews.title: Yea!!! No more keys!
customer_reviews.text: I should have done this years ago. It’s so nice not to have to carry a key. Simple to use and you can change the codes whenever you want to. I ordered two. After about a couple weeks, one of them sporadically stopped working. I called the company and they replaced it for free. They were very nice on the phone and we went over all the troubleshooting to make sure this item was indeed a lemon. Got a replacement in about 10 days. I love these locks.
customer_reviews.author: GSB

customer_reviews.title: Not for cold temperatures
customer_reviews.text: When these work they are wonderful. This is our 2nd one. We thought the first one (purchased in 2012) was simply worn out as it quit working consistently. Cold weather seems to affect the performance. We purchased this one in August. It is also affected by cold weather and will not work consistently in temperatures below 30 degrees. We are disappointed that we cannot trust this to work.
customer_reviews.author: Julie Flynn

customer_reviews.title: Faulty Exterior Lock
customer_reviews.text: Loved the product initially when it worked. But after a few months, the exterior lock started spinning, not engaging the deadbolt. As other customers have noted, it's a faulty lock mechanism. We tried brand new batteries, door open and closed, and the lock would spin 90% of the time, only catching and moving the deadbolt about 10% of the time. Sent it back.
customer_reviews.author: AngelGirl2000

customer_reviews.title: Love this product!
customer_reviews.text: LOVE THIS DEADBOLT. I have never had to use keys in 28 years and I wasn’t going to start now. I love this for myself, but also being able to add and delete extra codes (I have a dog walker with her own code). Only downfall is the keys do not light up until you touch each one so if it’s dark out and my porch lights isn’t on, I usually am doing it by feel. Hasn’t been a real big issue though. Definitely recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Stacey

customer_reviews.title: I would highly recommend this, I have the more expensive model installed ...
customer_reviews.text: I have 3 of this for my 2 garage and side entrance, It is worth the money knowing that you wont need any more keys. You can put a codes for each of your family members, plus codes for visitors or deliveries, I just erase it and put a new one everytime it was used. I would highly recommend this, I have the more expensive model installed in my front door .Also by Schlage.
customer_reviews.author: don

customer_reviews.title: Failed after a few months.
customer_reviews.text: Failed after several months. It works for a while but then fails. You can easily lock yourself out and then have to squeeze through your doggy door to get inside. The issue is the thing keeps spinning and won’t let you unlock the door. I would highly recommend a different option.
customer_reviews.author: Kc Calhoun

customer_reviews.title: Pretty Lock / Easy Installation
customer_reviews.text: I'm not a super handy lady and found this easy to install. All you need is a phillips (cross tip) screwdriver; the directions specifically say to not install with a power drill. The directions are easy to follow and are very clear. Good quality lock and aesthetically pleasing. I like that I can easily program a code for keyless entry and later delete if needed for family and or visitors.
customer_reviews.author: Cameo

customer_reviews.title: Great purchase
customer_reviews.text: I installed the lock with no trouble replacing a standard deadbolt. No alteration was needed. It was a direct replacement. It is on a main entry door from the garage into the house. It has really simplified our lives not having to use a key for entry. I ,also, liked that it has a key back-up in the event of battery failure.
customer_reviews.author: Ted

customer_reviews.title: Great looks and functionality.
customer_reviews.text: Easy to install as I was replacing an existing Schlage deadbolt. I have an older Kwikset keypad deadbolt on my garage door which works great but requires accurate alignment or it will use up batteries if there is any friction. This Schlage deadbolt has a clever system where you type in the code and it engages the deadbolt which you then unlock by hand. To lock you just hit one button and lock by hand. No more opening the door as my kids forgot their key! Looks great with the matching Schlage handle. It also has the option for extra codes to be added for temporary visitors.
customer_reviews.author: CD

customer_reviews.title: Description of product lacks key details
customer_reviews.text: We wanted electronic locks with Z-Wave capability, but the description on all the Schlage electronic locks sold on Amazon lack that key detail in the description. This lock does not have it from what we can tell (still not sure). It would be nice to have that feature as a part of those that have it and indicate if it is not a part of those that do not have it. Saves buying and testing locks with no success.
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: good lock, get this one. (you don't want the type with a motor)
customer_reviews.text: Good lock, easy to program and use. This type does not have the motor that turns the bolt which means that the battery will last way longer and you don't have to worry too much if your door isn't aligned perfect. you put in your code and then it lets you unlock manually. Perfect, and just what I want. Very happy with it. You can get fancy with all the remote alexa yada yada but really, you just want something like this with a backup keyhole for when it dies in a year.
customer_reviews.author: Sammy the Bull

customer_reviews.title: Lock does not consistently engage in low temps
customer_reviews.text: I've had this lock for exactly 14 months. It has worked great until the temperature drops to around freezing in which case it slips and the bolt Kris spinning without engaging. If you managed to lock it when you left the house, you might end up stuck outside in below freezing weather because it won't open. Thoroughly disappointed about this.
customer_reviews.author: <DZNTZ>

customer_reviews.title: Great Accessibility and Security Option
customer_reviews.text: This is a great option for someone looking to add a keypad to their home. The thing I really like about the Schlage keypads is that you still have to turn the knob to unlock the deadbolt. I like this because there is less chance the product will fail since there are fewer moving parts. I could see where some may not like this though especially if your hands are full when you are trying to get through the door. Installation was relatively easy, not much more difficult than installing a regular deadbolt. I would definitely purchase this again.
customer_reviews.author: Dusty F.

customer_reviews.title: New locks are terrible.
customer_reviews.text: I own two of these locks, an older one and a newer one. People are saying that there must have been a change in the new models because they are junk. I can verify this, my new one lasted less than a year before the locking mechanism stopped catching the deadbolt and just spins forever. The old one I've had for years and still works great. They need to ditch whatever cost saving move they made that turned their locks into junk. I won't be buying any more of these and you shouldn't either. Consider yourself warned.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin

customer_reviews.title: Secure and Realiable
customer_reviews.text: This is my second one (my tenant really gave the other one a beating). When it was brand new and taken care of, it lasted for 4 years. It will probably last forever if you don’t treat it like my tenant did. I think he was slamming the door with the dead bold out. It makes entering and exiting quicker and much more seamless. Carry the key with you too Incase the battery dies, which is rare. I never had issues with malfunctions and I like that you can add or delete different access codes.
customer_reviews.author: ctabata

customer_reviews.title: Worked great for about a month, now only works about half the time
customer_reviews.text: You know what is annoying? Having a keyless entry deadbolt that sometimes will not open when you type in your code. Tried replacing the battery - that's not the problem. At first, I thought it was just fat-finger typing the code, but it has continued to get worse and worse. And now, its been about 6 months since I bought it and don't want to leave the door unlocked to try tor return the product. Unfortunate - I've used this brand before without problem.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Aldrich

customer_reviews.title: Exactly what I wanted
customer_reviews.text: This lock has a four digit code I created and can store multiple codes. It does not have blue tooth, wifi, usb or any other communication. Call me a skeptic but I keep seeing IoT devices getting hacked and I don't want my door hacked. I did down grade this review 1 star because this one replaced on that wore out after 3 years. But it only took 20 min to replace and reprogram.
customer_reviews.author: Sharon

customer_reviews.title: locked out!!
customer_reviews.text: look nice, but eight months in and I'm locked out of my workshop . Have same problem with two of the three I put in. put code in hear the click but knob just spins freely and doesn't move deadbolt. Have to return to be inspected before receiving replacement. How do I lock the door with it in the mail ?
customer_reviews.author: Di

customer_reviews.title: Quality product and Great Price !!!
customer_reviews.text: This thing was soooo easy to install. It fit right in the hole of the old deadbolt we removed. We took out the old one and replaced with this one on our front door. Even low level do-it-yourselfers like us had the new one in within 10 minute. It has a beautiful finish too, very rich looking. I love that It is level 2 which means I feel safer than I would have with some cheap lock. But this one was 10% less than the same one when I priced it at my local big box hardware store. Now I don't have to carry keys when I go jogging or walk the dog. Love it!!!
customer_reviews.author: Doctorii

customer_reviews.title: No light. You can’t see the buttons in the dark!
customer_reviews.text: It’s a pretty hardy duty lock. It was a bit complicated to install. The only bad thing about this lock is that there is no light. So at night it makes it very difficult to push the keys. It’s very inconvenient because I have to pull out my cell phone so I can see the buttons.
customer_reviews.author: Shabana

customer_reviews.title: New and improved
customer_reviews.text: I had the older version of this lock and was hesitant to buy another. I was under pressure to buy something so I got this one feeling it would give me time to find another. It is awesome! The new version eliminated all of the problems I had with the old one. It is more solid and reliable great value. I would recommend this lock.
customer_reviews.author: Richard M.

customer_reviews.title: Using the key, not so easy, but still good
customer_reviews.text: Bought these for the ease of keyless entry not too bad to install and program but to unlock with a key is very strange. Have to push in with the key turn 90 degrees then turn back, them turn all the way around to take key out. Quite odd and not easy. But should only need to use the key of the battery goes. Have a emtek in front door, much easier to use.
customer_reviews.author: Rosemarei

customer_reviews.title: Love these!  We've been using them for years.
customer_reviews.text: It's been several years since we bought our first one, and since then we've used about a dozen of them on rental properties, etc. They're the best keypad lock currently made. There were some issues with some of them not locking. Apparently Schlage had a manufacturing issue for a while with them. But they sent us replacement locks for free by mail when I contacted them about it.
customer_reviews.author: david

customer_reviews.title: Malfunction Lock
customer_reviews.text: Lock was purchased and installed. we did not use it since it was for a AIR BNB room, we just found out that the mechanisms on the lock are broken inside and it will not operate properly. I have not been able to reach the seller/vendor to resolve this and I am out the money and do not have a operating lock
customer_reviews.author: sabrina

customer_reviews.title: terrific item
customer_reviews.text: i've had several of these and this one is the best. i really like that the code engages a pin that allows the deadbolt to be moved (by hand-turning the knob). this design saves battery by doing very little work (ie, the deadbolt itself is not moved by the motor, just that pin) and makes the lock more secure. i've had this for 8 months and it still works (and looks) great.
customer_reviews.author: kglad

customer_reviews.title: Garbage
customer_reviews.text: So nice not having to dig for your keys, my wife and I had this model on the old house we sold, when we moved to our new place we ordered this after 2 days because it is SO convenient and you'll never worry about your kids getting locked out! Update: The lock stopped working, the catch mechanism is broken so you can turn the bolt closed from the key pad side. I’m outside my order return window but will be contacting the manufacture for a replacement.
customer_reviews.author: Tom-Tom

customer_reviews.title: Good Lock
customer_reviews.text: A good solid lock and easy to install. The two downsides are that the keypad side wouldn't fit tight against the door so I had to grind off two screws and two gusset type castings. And also, it only came with one key. I would expect at least two keys would come with a $80+ lock.
customer_reviews.author: Janet L. Hegwood

customer_reviews.title: Well worth the time  & effort it took to install but worth the effort
customer_reviews.text: The directions left a lot to be desired leaving out some pertinent info. I was convinced it was broken in shipping. Was going to return it till I decided to call Schlage. The tech was wonderful & explained exactly what to do & how to do it even staying on the phone till I got it all done He agreed the instructions leave a few pertinent details out. So schlage is a great company so is the customer support & the lock is wonderful. How much is too much.
customer_reviews.author: Wolf Spirit

customer_reviews.title: Great product. Seller was very helpful.
customer_reviews.text: Excellent door lock. I saw the same one at the hardware store for more than $100. It works great! Just a tip -- when it is installed, the part that spins around, under the key pad is SUPPOSED to spin!!! I thought it was broken since it didn't sit stationary. Once you punch the secret code on the key pad, it trips the lock to open and close it properly. Fairly easy to install. We did have to get a door know hole drill bit, so it took extra time. Plus it was a metal door, so drilling wasn't too fun! Great product.
customer_reviews.author: jlo

customer_reviews.title: I've owned 4 of these for 5 years. over ...
customer_reviews.text: I've owned 4 of these for 5 years. over time the buttons do wear down and you can see which ones are used and which are not. in over 5 years ive never needed to change the batteries, however i used high dollar (v batteries as opposed to the supplied ones. weather is colorado so warm summers and cold winters.
customer_reviews.author: BAMBAM

customer_reviews.title: Recommend Schlage: Good electronic coded, non-home-linked door lock option
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this lock to replace the exact same model, so I was familiar with the straightforward installation. After about 10 years, the old lock stopped disengaging and defaulted to a fail safe position (ie, deadbolt always engaged). Rather than try to fix a worn part, I ordered a new one, which arrived in one day and as expected. Installation was simple because the necessary holes were already drilled for the old lock. The new lock included basic programming instructions and not full printed version of programming options, but I had the booklet from my old lock. The Schlage BE365CAM619 is a good, reliable option for an electronic coded lock that does not require or use an internet-connected, "home-linked" system.
customer_reviews.author: WilC

customer_reviews.title: The company stands behind their product very impressed
customer_reviews.text: Dealing with a company they truly stand behind their product have their product on 3 door’s in my home and I am impressedThe company stands behind their product very impressed,Live in a very humid state and the locks have stayed perfect condition no pitting and no loss of luster definitely worth the money
customer_reviews.author: Donnarose

customer_reviews.title: Most important home upgrade you'll buy!
customer_reviews.text: This is the second set of this door lock we've bought. Only because we moved... not because there was an issue. I will never live anywhere without one of these. It's easy to program a temporary code for housekeeping or dog sitters and most people are smart enough to figure out how to get in...not all, mind you. Public school has left our world lacking in semi-intelligent people, so some people will not be able to get in your house to water your plants or tidy up, but really, if they can't open a door, do you want them in your house?
customer_reviews.author: Lisa P.

customer_reviews.title: Great lock
customer_reviews.text: Bought two of these and the are working great! One thing I like from a cheaper model I bought is that it has a 6 digit programming code rather than a 4 digit one. Just seems a little more secure that someone couldn't "guess" your code to then program in an entrance code. Although, on the cheaper model, it doesn't allow programming from the locked position, so I guess either way is relatively safe. Love that you can delete the codes and enter up to 19! Plan on using it for pet sitters and friends who check on things while I'm on vacation!
customer_reviews.author: Sparkyn98

customer_reviews.title: Recommended
customer_reviews.text: We love this lock so much that we bought a second for another door. Color does go a bit brassy after a couple of years and the plastic coating on the numbers can lift off but still functional more than four years later. We change batteries yearly because a friend didn’t and got locked out after a vacation.
customer_reviews.author: april d fieno

customer_reviews.title: Pretty good. Could be better tho.
customer_reviews.text: The lock itself is ok; what you would expect. Not very sophisticated tho. The main issue I have with it is the lack of variability in the auto-lock: it’s about 15 seconds. Would prefer longer. It is very annoying when you walk outside for one minute and then have to unlock the door again, maybe with your hands full. Not very convenient. It would be nice to have an auto lock capability similar to the August lock. Nothing like that in this system.
customer_reviews.author: Barry Bannister

customer_reviews.title: No more copying house keys!
customer_reviews.text: It's so liberating to go for a walk and not bring a house key. I'm so happy not to make any more keys for family members, and not worry about what happened to the ones that are out there. It's good to know that if I no longer want someone to have access I can just delete their code. DO be sure to keep handy the directions on how to add / delete. You can "favorite" it in your photos so you can find it again later!
customer_reviews.author: A Reader

customer_reviews.title: Super easy
customer_reviews.text: I definitely would recommend this to anyone. I bought a "Brink" model and I don't like it as much as this one. This one you can push the button and (turn) lock it fast as oppose to the Brink model where I push the button and I wait for it to lock on it's own which takes longer than to just turn it and go. Fast shipping and great product!
customer_reviews.author: KERRY LANE

customer_reviews.title: Buyer beware; lock just spins and spins
customer_reviews.text: Buyer beware. This lock stopped working after one year, but hey, the reviews are great. We use it on our Airbnb and didn’t have time to order another from Amazon. So, we went and bought the same model from Lowe’s. We got a call from our Airbnb guests over the weekend, and the lock has literally stopped working after 3 uses. That’s right: THREE. The knob just spins and spins and never catches. Schlage might be getting bombarded by similar complaints because I got an automatic email asking me for pictures of the lock, etc etc and that they would answer me when they got through the “higher influx of emails.”
customer_reviews.author: Loosh

customer_reviews.title: Only one key included
customer_reviews.text: They always included 2 keys in the past. Now only one key is included, just to save a few pennies in production. Since we are using these locks for our rentals, it means, going to the hardware store each time when a new lock is installed and going back to give the key to the tenant. Costwise for me, $25 expense (time to go for spare key) just for Schlage to save a few. Unfortunate...
customer_reviews.author: Da Hans

customer_reviews.title: Not always working
customer_reviews.text: Sorry to say but this lock is not like the last Schlage luck I had. This works sometimes then other times it doesn’t. I’m returning it as soon as I get another one.
customer_reviews.author: kmFlorida

customer_reviews.title: good key pad but you pay for it.
customer_reviews.text: So, we ordered three of these. Front, back and garage door. Two of the three worked great right out of the box and are still awesome 2 years later. The third one was a dud from the start. The dud was finicky to program and crapped out within a week. The company replaced it with a great one. Happy with the functions and I love that you can program more than one code. We have one for the family, one for extended family's use of our garage and one for the house cleaner. Great customer service but 1/3 of our ordered product did not work. I hope that is because we had a small sample size.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer D. Mosher

customer_reviews.title: Own both touchscreen and non-touchscreen
customer_reviews.text: It's great, we'd had it for years now. Unlike the touchscreen deadbolt by Schlage, this one is more basic. Now basic is a good thing, you don't have worry about a defective motor (had to return my first touchscreen one). This model unlocks much faster instead of having to wait for the motor to unlock for you (great if you're running late, and have to get back inside because you left something). The only difference is size since the touchscreen model takes up significantly more space, and that model can connect to wifi/program to unlock/lock the door (which you have to pay a monthly fee).
customer_reviews.author: KS

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: Why did it take me so long to buy one of these? After years of fussing with keys, I finally came to my senses and bought one of these units. I nearly bought a cheaper model from another manufacturer, but I'm so glad I noticed this Schlage model at the last minute. I have another Schlage deadbolt in my home (non-keypad) and after seeing that quality, I knew this would be good. Easy to install, flawless operation.
customer_reviews.author: K. O'Meara

customer_reviews.title: short warranty
customer_reviews.text: I've bought two of these. The first one lasted several years. The second one lasted just a little over a year...just past the electronic 1 year warranty. Will be trying another brand.
customer_reviews.author: Sandie Speichinger

customer_reviews.title: Doesn’t last long. Stopped working in 18 mo.
customer_reviews.text: Lock was easy to Install. Worked great for about 18 months. Then it was hit or miss until now it never works from the outside...the deadbolt just spins and never engages. Enter codes and just spins and spins. Fortunately it does still lick fro the inside. Not worth the $87 or so bucks
customer_reviews.author: Sam

customer_reviews.title: Great for a six month lease
customer_reviews.text: Worked great for exactly one year. Battery change every six months. Right now it will not lock or unlock even with a fresh battery. Guess you get what you pay for.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great so far
customer_reviews.text: Decided to try the whole roommate thing and did not want to give out keys to my home. Put this on the door to enter from the garage and it works perfectly. Everyone can get their own entry code they can remember and you can easily remove the code once your situation changes. Great buy. I have had it about 10 months now and no problems. Had my parent install for me and installation was fairly easy.
customer_reviews.author: ShaLonda Palmore II

customer_reviews.title: Lasted for 20 months
customer_reviews.text: When I installed this lock, it was just a little too wide as it crushed the outside insulation around the door. But it worked just fine ... until the release started spinning without engaging the deadbolt. It's apparently a flaw with mechanism inside the keypad side of the lock and I was unable to access it for repair.
customer_reviews.author: K. A. Rice

customer_reviews.title: The name brand proves itself to me each day
customer_reviews.text: I've tried the other brands, the ones you don't know but think about using because of a price deal, and this one is much better than the other no name ones. I'm usually the generic product buying guy, but I bought two of these and one was to replace the el cheapo one I bought from a no name and the difference in feel and operation is big. I use this one everyday and get a tiny happiness charge each time I hear it work with a solid lock and clear light up. Great quality, worth the name brand.
customer_reviews.author: Creighton Yost

customer_reviews.title: Great door keypad deadbolt
customer_reviews.text: A few years ago I installed a BE365 deadbolt and I like the certainty of a manually operated the deadbolt. I have another keypad deadbolt that is battery powered, however if the deadbolt doesn't extend you need to look for the warning light and listen for the beep. The installation is relatively easy and the instructions are good except they do not mention that to use the metal key you must continue to press it in while turning it to engage the deadbolt mechanism. Unfortunately this package includes only one metal key. The YouTube installation video is helpful. The additional programming instructions on the Schlage website is important to see.
customer_reviews.author: Tom & Jeanne

customer_reviews.title: Must check before you buy
customer_reviews.text: You must check this before you choice. This keypad haven't handle. you have to install this item door with handle. There should be a separate handle. I didn't recognize and remove handle. there is a reason why this is cheaper.
customer_reviews.author: Youngsun Kim

customer_reviews.title: If you have teenagers you need this!
customer_reviews.text: What a fantastic product for those who have teenagers or need to make their house accessible to friends, family, and guest. The lock was a breeze to install and I no longer have to worry about lost or misplaced keys. My kids were forever losing their keys. Now they don't have to use a key. I don't have to rush home to let them in, and if they give out the combination I can change it. I can leave my guest at home and they can go out and lock up when they leave. I honestly don't know how I lived without this lock.
customer_reviews.author: PaPa160

customer_reviews.title: Didn’t last
customer_reviews.text: We bought this in August 2018. It worked great for the first year but now we are having consistent issues locking it. As described in offer reviews, when we try to lock it, the lock just keep spinning in circles and doesn’t lock. We are looking for a new options and I’m disappointed to have only gotten a year out of this lock.
customer_reviews.author: C. moll

product_meta.title: Schlage BE365CAM619 Be365 Camelot Keypad Deadbolt, Satin Nickel
product_meta.description: Size:CamelotSchlage Be365 Camelot keypad deadbolt adds convenience to functionality with its keyless option while still maintaining the integrity of a keyed deadbolt for versatility. Battery operated for ease of installation. It is the perfect addition for both exterior and interior applications where security is essential. Backed by a limited lifetime mechanical and finish warranty and 1 year electronic. Ideal for front doors, side & back doors, garage entry doors, etc
feature_bullets: Create and delete access codes for trusted friends and family (up to 19)
Guaranteed to fit on standard doors. Backset of universal latches and deadbolts fits 2 to 0.375 inch or 2 to0.75 inch backsets
Silicone coated keypad prevents numbers from wearing off
Pairs with our most popular trim styles to coordinate the look throughout your home
Installs in minutes no wiring needed;Door thickness range: 1 3/8 inches to 1 3/4 inches thick (35mm 44mm) standard,Thick door kit available

specifications.Included Components: Camelot Keypad Deadbolt, 6 Digit Programming Code, 9-Volt Battery
specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.3 out of 5 stars2,785 ratings4.3 out of 5 stars
